title: Are Christians allowed to listen to any other music than gospel? - Quora

response.answer_text: Of course, Christians are allowed to listen to other music. Who did you think can forbid a Christian from listening to certain music? God has not given such authority to anyone (apart from the authority that parents have over their children). The Bible is silent on musical styles. The Bible speaks against obscene and violent lyrics. However, the decision of what music to listen to is between the Christian and God. If God and the person's conscience don't forbid a person from listening then the person is free to listen.

Allowed? Paul says you can do whatever you want but that not everything is beneficial for you. It’s a matter of conscience as determined by where you are in your faith walk rather than as an external set of rules.
Some are, some are pretty uptight and their beliefs discourage listening to any other kind. Quakers and Jehovah’s Witnesses come to mind. Most do anyway.
I don't think Jesus is really fussed if you listen to other types of music. I really do think he would rather you focus on helping people and being compassionate to them.
